settings.text: Allroad Bikes: Carbon, Custom, British Built

settings.content:
Allroad bikes from Handsling provide the versatility to take you from the road to the trails. They maintain the speed and efficiency of a road bike, while offering stability and tyre clearance for the dirt. 

We size you first, then UK-assemble your custom build: wheels, tyres, crank length, gear ratios, bar width, stem length and paint. Built on the same UCI-approved platforms trusted by elite riders worldwide.

FREE PAINT - Order before 31st January to get free paint (applies to Handsling colour palette only).

settings.title: Promote a product or a temporary offer
How much will your Handsling Bike be with cycle to work scheme vouchers?
Learn how Handsling can personalise your bike to your performance needs.
Sized To You
settings.content:
We size first, build second.
Remote Tailored Sizing sets stack, reach, bar width and saddle height so your allroad bicycle stays comfortable and controlled on mixed surfaces.

settings.title: Tailored To You
settings.content:
Spec it your way.
A bespoke allroad bike with your drivetrain, wheel depth, tyres, and 130+ paint variations – finished in-house by our team in the UK.

settings.title: Engineered For All Roads
settings.content:
Engineered to win, tuned for every road.
In-house carbon design with efficient aerodynamics and wide-tyre clearance; UCI-approved and validated in competition.

settings.title: Ride Experience
settings.content:
• Efficient on asphalt, stable on rough lanes: aero tube shaping helps you hold pace, then the frame settles into confident control on mixed surfaces.
  • Tyre clearance up to 55mm gives you room to tune for comfort, grip and speed across everything from broken B-roads to hardpack.
  • Balanced geometry keeps the bike stable at higher speeds yet responsive under cornering and acceleration.
  • Carbon lay-up filters road vibration so long days feel smoother.
  • Equally at home on audax rides, fast light touring or multi-surface commutes.

settings.title: Performance
settings.content:
• Race-informed, truncated aerofoil profiles adapted for allroad efficiency.
  • T47 internal bottom bracket for a wide, stiff interface and reliable power transfer.
  • Longer wheelbase and a lower BB height promote stability on loose surfaces.
  • Oversized front end preserves steering precision on broken lanes and when sprinting.
  • Aero-into-27.2 mm seat tube works with standard posts and is dropper-compatible for added control.

settings.title: Frame Design & Manufacture
settings.content:
• Engineered in-house, drawing on the popular A1R0evo road bike frame.
  • Toray T800 carbon fibre balances low weight with durability for multi-surface use.
  • Latex-wrapped EPS internal moulding achieves high compaction and a clean internal finish.
  • Integrated mounts for mudguards, racks and multiple bottles keep the bike practical for all-weather and long-distance setups.

settings.title: Bike Customisation
settings.content:
• Built as a carbon allroad bike around your fit and routes – tempo road days, endurance mileage or light off-road links.
  • Drivetrain options from Shimano, SRAM, Campagnolo or Classified.
  • Wheelsets tuned for paved speed or extra robustness; tyre choices from fast slicks to multi-surface tread.
  • 130+ paint and logo combinations to create a truly bespoke finish.

settings.title: Customer Support
settings.content:
• Direct contact with Handsling’s team of cycling experts.
  • Hand-assembled in Hampshire, UK, quality-tested before handover.
  • Limited lifetime frame warranty for lasting confidence.
  • Ongoing aftercare for upgrades, servicing and setup advice.

settings.title: A1R0evoG: Carbon Allroad Bike
settings.content:
Built on Handsling’s UCI-approved, flagship carbon fibre road bike platform and assembled in the UK to your fit, the A1R0evoG is the fastest way to cover mixed surfaces. It keeps the road bike pace on the asphalt, then settles into confident control on broken lanes and off-road surfaces – an allroad bicycle you can tailor from tyres to drivetrain.

Ready for Every Road

Set your position, pick your kit, and we’ll build a high-performance bespoke bike around your routes.

settings.title: Ride Experience
settings.content:
• Balanced and responsive – composed handling on rough lanes, agile under cornering and responsive under acceleration.
  • Up to 40 mm tyres tune grip, comfort and rolling speed for everything from patched B-roads to firm gravel.
  • Carbon lay-up filters vibration to keep you fresher on longer mixed-surface days.
  • Equally at home on tarmac, cobbles and firm hardpack.

settings.title: Performance
settings.content:
• UCI-approved, race-proven platform optimised for gravel, road and cyclocross competition.
  • Stiff, lightweight carbon turns effort into speed on climbs and flat sections.
  • Oversized head tube, down tube and BB area help channel power and keep steering precise.
  • Wheelbase stability supports control when surfaces deteriorate.

settings.title: Frame Design & Manufacture
settings.content:
• Toray T800 carbon fibre schedule balances low weight with durability for allroad use.
  • Latex-wrapped EPS internal moulding for high compaction and a clean internal finish.
  • Frame weight: ~870 g (52 cm); fork: ~370 g – competitive among lightweight allroad/gravel race frames.
  • Internal routing and neat junctions for an efficient, aero-aware silhouette.

settings.title: Bike Customisation
settings.content:
• Built around your fit, routes and priorities: tempo road rides, long endurance days or links of firm off-road.
  • Drivetrain options from Shimano, SRAM, Campagnolo or Classified (subject to availability).
  • Wheelset choices for paved speed or extra robustness; tyres from fast slicks to multi-surface tread.
  • 130+ paint and logo combinations, plus limited editions, to create a one-off finish.
  • Remote Tailored Sizing included to set stack/reach, cockpit and contact points before assembly.

settings.title: Customer Service
settings.content:
• Direct, expert help. Speak with the Handsling team of specialists from first enquiry to handover.
  • Transparent progress updates; bikes are UK-assembled and quality-checked in our Hampshire factory before collection or delivery.
  • Ongoing support for pressure guidance, gearing tweaks, cockpit adjustments and upgrade paths as your riding evolves.
  • Every CEXevo frame is covered by a limited lifetime frame warranty.

settings.title: CEXevo: Carbon Allroad Bike
settings.content:
Born from Handsling’s elite racing pedigree, the CEXevo is a fast, versatile carbon allroad bike you can ride anywhere. A UCI-approved carbon bike refined in competition, sized to your position and UK-assembled to your spec, it carries speed on the road and stays composed when the surface turns rough.

Bespoke from From Fit to Finish

Your measurements, your components, your paint – delivered ready to ride.

settings.author: Road.cc on the Handsling CEXevo SRAM Force AXS
settings.content: "..You won't be disappointed with the CEXevo. It's fast and fun to ride, a proper grin inducing machine"
The CEXevo is amazing; really inspired confidence with stability blended with tight handling.
The CEXevo is amazing; really inspired confidence with stability blended with tight handling.
The bike is light, which helps over cyclocross hurdles, yet stiff enough for good power transfer in differing conditions and terrain.

settings.title: CEXevo at the Transcontinental Race
settings.content: A self-supported epic of 3,000km+ demands pace on tarmac and composure when the surface breaks up. Riders chose the CEXevo carbon allroad bike for its efficiency and control across changing conditions – real proof that an allroad setup can stay fast and dependable over ultra-distance.

settings.title: First Customer Builds Show the A1R0evoG’s Allroad Range
settings.content: The A1R0evoG’s versatility is already showing through the first customer builds – from bikepacking-ready setups to bikes intended for elite gravel racing. As an allroad bicycle, it’s being built to match different riding styles, while keeping the same core focus on speed, control, and reliability across mixed terrain.

settings.title: Allroad Performance, Verified by Riders
settings.content: Rider-led features proving how a measured fit and tailored builds make our allroad bikes quick on the road and confident off it.

settings.title: 130+ Colourways, Painted in the UK
settings.content: Team-match or stand out. Our 130+ finish options pair crisp logos with coatings chosen for long seasons of riding – completed in-house at our UK factory.
Book a test ride today at Handsling's UK workshop. Or schedule a video call with the sales team.

settings.title: What is an allroad bike?
settings.content:
An allroad bike is set up for mixed surfaces: quick on tarmac, composed on broken lanes and firm hardpack. Typical traits include room for wider tyres (often 28-35 mm or more) and stable handling. Materials vary – you’ll find carbon, aluminium and (less commonly) steel or titanium.

Handsling allroad builds use high-performance carbon fibre frames and are UK-assembled to your confirmed fit.

settings.title: Which bike is best for me – the A1R0evoG or CEXevo?
settings.content:
Pick A1R0evoG if you want range for rough UK lanes: aero-optimised T800 carbon, T47 BB, tyre clearance up to ~55 mm, and multiple mounts for practical setups. Choose CEXevo if you lean toward all-road/firm-gravel and cyclocross racing DNA: UCI-approved T800 carbon with up to ~40 mm tyres and a race-proven feel.

We’ll confirm the right frame during Remote Tailored Sizing.

settings.title: Allroad bikes vs gravel bikes – which is best?
settings.content:
It comes down to surface split.

  • Allroad: road-first. Keeps road-bike pace on tarmac and stays composed on broken lanes and firm hardpack. Typically pairs a measured road position with moderately wider tyres for comfort and control.
  • Gravel: off-road-first. Prioritises stability and traction on loose surfaces, with geometry and components chosen for rougher tracks and longer unpaved sections.

 If most rides are paved with occasional firm links, our allroad builds are the better match. If you’re planning regular dirt and loose surfaces, our gravel bikes range – built with the same fit-first process – will suit you more.

settings.title: What is a carbon allroad bike’s advantage over aluminium?
settings.content: Carbon enables more aerodynamic shaping, better stiffness-to-weight, and improved vibration damping than aluminium, which helps maintain speed and reduce road buzz on mixed surfaces. It also supports neat internal routing and seatpost shapes for clean builds.

settings.title: What tyre width suits allroad bikes for UK roads?
settings.content: Broadly, 30–32 mm works well for paved roads and rougher tarmac; 30–35 mm adds comfort and grip for backlanes and firm hardpack. Your ideal width depends on weight, terrain and preference; start conservative and adjust. The A1R0evoG accepts tyres up to ~55 mm (with appropriate wheels/clearance checks); CEXevo up to ~45 mm.

settings.title: What gear range is best for mixed-surface cycling routes?
settings.content: Most riders choose 2x for steady cadence and a wider usable range on rolling routes. 1x is simpler and works if your terrain and cadence targets suit the larger jumps.

settings.title: Can I visit your UK factory for a test ride?
settings.content: Absolutely. You can book a test-ride or fitting consultation at our Hampshire facility. It’s a great opportunity to meet the team, see where our carbon allroad bikes are hand assembled, and discuss your build. To arrange a visit, contact sales@handslingbikes.com or call 01420 612700.

settings.title: What is the lead time for Handsling custom allroad bikes?
settings.content: Typical lead time is around 6-8 weeks, depending on paint and component availability. We size you first, agree the specification, book the paint slot, then assemble and quality-check in our UK workshop. If you have a deadline, we’ll recommend in-stock options to keep timings tight.

settings.title: Frequently Asked Questions
settings.content:
Learn about Handsling bikes and what separates us from the competition. For questions on ordering, delivery, maintenance, and much more, go to our support centre.

If an allroad bike isn't for you, explore carbon fibre road bikes, road race bikes, custom track bikes, TT bikes , gravel-ready bikes triathlon bikes.
